titleStmt.title: The improvement of mercy: or a short treatise, shewing how, and in what manner, our rulers and all well-affected to the present government should make a right and profitable use of the late great victory in Ireland. August 2. 1649. Also here are severall things propounded to all such as are dis-affected and enemies to the state (whether Presbyterian, Royalist, or Papist, &c.) beeing both usefull and seasonable upon this occasion, of so wonderfull and glorious a victorie. / By John Canne. Published by authoritie.
titleStmt.author: Canne, John, d. 1667?

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by M. Simmons in Aldersgate-street,

notesStmt.note: Reproductions of the originals in Cambridge University Library (Early English Books) and the British Library (Thomason Tracts).
